# Copilot Instructions for ZippelLabs.github.io

- **Stack**: Vite multi-page TypeScript site (no React). Dev/build via `npm run dev`, `npm run build` (runs `tsc` then `vite build`), `npm run preview`. Only dev deps (Tailwind 4, PostCSS, TS, Vite); no runtime libs.
- **Entrypoints**: `vite.config.ts` defines three HTML inputs (`index.html`, `audits.html`, `research.html`). Each page mounts into `#app` and renders markup from its TS file (`src/main.ts`, `src/audits.ts`, `src/research.ts`). Keep new pages consistent by adding an HTML entry plus a TS file that writes `app.innerHTML` and runs page-local init functions.
- **Home page (`src/main.ts`)**: ~1k LOC template string defining all sections (hero, stats, coverage, process tabs, testimonials, CTAs). Interactions are plain DOM utilities declared at top: nav scroll class toggle, intersection-observer reveals (`.animate-on-scroll`, `.reveal`, `.reveal-stagger`), expandables via `.expand-trigger` + `data-target`, coverage filter buttons (`.filter-btn` vs `.coverage-stack-card[data-category]`), process step tabs (`.process-tab` vs `.process-panel[data-step]`), mobile menu toggle (#mobile-menu-toggle / #mobile-menu), stats counter animation once-on-view. If you add sections, reuse these class hooks so animations still work.
- **Terminal hero**: `src/components/TerminalHero.ts` renders the faux terminal into a supplied element ID (used with `hero-terminal-container` in `main.ts`). It sequentially types lines with optional styles (command/output/success/error/warning) and reveals the CTA by removing `opacity-0` from `#hero-cta-container`. Extend messages by appending to `runSequence` or by adding new `typeLine` calls; keep delays modest to avoid long blocking.
- **Research page (`src/research.ts`)**: Builds its own navigation and sections (hero, featured research cards, focus areas, CTA). Uses shared mobile menu + nav scroll + reveal animations + holo-card mouse tracking. Research cards use `.handbook-card` with `holo-card`-style hover effect; keep those classes to preserve styling.
- **Audits page (`src/audits.ts`)**: Audit request form posts to FormSubmit (`action="https://formsubmit.co/zippellabs@gmail.com"` plus `_subject`, `_next`, `_template`, `_captcha=false`, honeypot `_honey`). If you modify the form, preserve these hidden inputs. Uses the same mobile menu pattern.
- **Styling**: Global design system lives in `src/style.css` (4.9k LOC). Defines CSS variables for the cyan/purple palette, backgrounds (grid + noise + scanline), typography, and UI atoms (nav, buttons, cards, stats, coverage, hero terminal, etc.). Tailwind directives are included but the bulk is bespoke CSS. When adding components, prefer reusing existing utility classes (`btn-primary/secondary`, `holo-card`, `section`, `section-heading`, `tag-chip`, etc.) to maintain look/feel; add new variables only if necessary.
- **Animations & interactions**: IntersectionObserver thresholds are tuned (0.1/0.15) to stagger reveals; fallbacks exist in `initScrollAnimations` for browsers without IntersectionObserver. Holographic hover uses `.pillar-card, .proof-card, .handbook-card, .stat-item, .holo-card` mousemove handler to set `--mouse-x/--mouse-y`. Stats counters attach to `.hero-stats, .stats-bar, .stats-section`â€”if you create new stat containers, add to the observer list.
- **Conventions**: All content is authored as template literals; no JSX. Keep IDs unique and match JS selectors. Navigation anchors expect section IDs (`#services`, `#coverage`, `#about`, `#handbooks`); preserve them or update links together. Forms and CTAs point to external socials; update both desktop and mobile menus in sync.
- **Adding functionality**: Implement small behaviors as local helper functions (see top of `main.ts`), then invoke after setting `innerHTML`. Prefer class toggles over inline styles; existing CSS already defines states (`.open`, `.active`, `.expanded`, `.is-hidden`, `.visible`, `.animate-fade-in-up`). For new animations, mirror the `animate-on-scroll`/`reveal` pattern instead of inventing new triggers.
- **Assets**: Uses `/logo.jpg` referenced from the public root and Google Fonts (Inter + JetBrains Mono) imported in `style.css`. Keep new assets under `public/` and reference with root-relative paths.
- **Testing/formatting**: No tests or linters configured. Keep code TypeScript-friendly (DOM types annotated where needed) and maintain ASCII-only edits.

If any section is unclear or misses a workflow you need, tell me and I will refine this file.
